column4: I seem to have a selective problem with Skype; I can call my other PC and the Test Service work fine, too. But when I call a certain friend, he can hear me for about 2 seconds, until my sound completly dies system wide. Ideas?
Too weird.
Sound Devices -> Auto Adjust Mixer Levels
I always turn the automatic adjustment OFF. It was turned ON today for an unknown reason.
ok
Reboot why?
I thought your sound was fixed when you shut down skype?
My Ubuntus (got 4) often stop doing misc. errors after a reboot. I know, rebooting Linux would usually not help, but my expirience tells another story.
ok
Skype wont let me call this one friend. I can call my other PC and the test service, though. So I suspect there is confusion somwhere in RAM.
Try calling me- sepero111
Does this tell you anything: http://pastebin.com/m386d7b3e
does this tell you anything: http://pastebin.com/m386d7b3e ?
I'm looking at it
The only thing I can recommend is trying different settings for SoundIn & SoundOut under Options -> Sound Devices
I already tried to switch over to ALSA. Skype wont work with anything except some certain out of 6 options. I will continue googleing. Thanks!
You might want to try searching google for the error output you have. Like "skype ltdl-bind-now.c: Failed"
It looks like it might be a limitation on your hardware.
It just started today, in the middle of a longer conversation. Fedora does not have this problem.
Ah, in that case, I would delete my skype settings folder under /home and put the settings back in.
I mean, manually put the settings back in.
ok, i must go. good luck
thx
